CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 27, 1956, pg. B1, reads: "'Eleanor Among Friends' - Allegheny County Democrats turned out in full force on Oct. 18, when Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt delivered a series of speeches in behalf of Stevenson and Kefauver, as well as all Democrats running for Federal and state offices. The picture above shows platform guests in Schenley High School Auditorium, where Mrs. Roosevelt shared speaking honors with Joseph S. Clark, candidate for the U.S. Senate. Reading from left to right are Mr. Clark, Mrs. David L. Lawrence, Mayor Lawrence, Mrs. Molly Yard, Mrs. Roosevelt, Thomas E. Barrett, Miss Genevieve Blatt, Paul F. Jones, master of ceremonies; Joseph M. Barr, Howard B. Stewart and Andrew M. Bradley. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Group seated on stage, from left: unknown, Joseph S. Clark, Alyce Lawrence, Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence, Molly Yard, and Eleanor Roosevelt, with Rev. LeRoy Patrick in background, in Schenley High School Auditorium for Adlai Stevenson campaign event
